message_1: Suppose you have a message "ATTACK AT DAWN" that you want to encrypt using a substitution cipher in which each letter is replaced by a number according to its position in the alphabet. What would be the encrypted message if the letter "A" is replaced by "3", the letter "D" is replaced by "8", and so on, up to "Z" being replaced by "26"?
message_2:
To encrypt the message "ATTACK AT DAWN" using the given substitution cipher, we will replace each letter with its corresponding number. We will also ignore the spaces in the message for encryption purposes.

A = 3
T = 20
T = 20
A = 3
C = 5
K = 14
(space)
A = 3
T = 20
(space)
D = 8
A = 3
W = 23
N = 17

The encrypted message would be: 3 20 20 3 5 14 3 20 8 3 23 17
